means: 不信任的，怀疑的，可疑的

sentence.Network_en: The older you get the more distrustful you become.
Voters are deeply distrustful of all politicians.
sentence.Network_cn: 选民对所有的政客都深表怀疑。

sentence.Network_en: His mouth was thin and evil, the eye distrustful.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是嘴薄而恶毒, 眼睛多疑.

PerfectNetExp.abs: distrust 不信任distrustful 不信任的disturb 弄乱
多字的解释--... ... 多疑〖 distrustful;oversuspicious;oversensitive〗 多嘴〖 talkative;speakoutofturn;shootoffone'smouth〗.
I'm skeptical about his words.distrustful 怀疑的，不相信的doubtful 怀疑的；
detached超然的；公平的；公允的distrustful不信任的, 怀疑的, 可疑的disparaging蔑视的, 毁谤的, 轻视的

list.abs: he distrusts banks so he keeps his money at home .他不信任银行，所以把钱放在家里。
you plant dishonesty , you will reap distrust ., 如果你种下谎言 , 你就会收获怀疑.
说起胡锦涛主席此次访美大背景，很多美国外交学者用了“互不信任”（mutual distrust）和“互相猜忌”（mutual suspicion）这两个词组。
diplomatic truce 外交休兵downright distrust 完全不信任complete equality 完全平等

entry.def: If you are distrustful of someone or something, you think that they are not honest, reliable, or safe.

example.ex: Voters are deeply distrustful of all politicians...
example.tran: 选民对所有的政客都深表怀疑。

example.ex: The older you get the more distrustful you become.

sentences.sentence: "my experience...in other fields of law has made me distrustful of rules of thumb generally"- B.N.Cardozo
